content: 3 yarn colours £ using the colour of row 25 yarn over pull it through the loop on the crochet hook and then pull it to close the st £ using a darning needle sew in all the yarn ends to secure them and trim off any excess yarn wet block or wash the potholder blocking is magic for crocheting we re going to wet block the potholder to even out the stitches and improve how it looks you can also follow these instructions when you wash the potholder here s what to do £ fill a bucket / bowl / sink with enough cool water to cover the potholder and mix in a small amount of wool detergent to it 16 happy potholder uk and us terminology v1 2 a homelea lass® crochet pattern ©homelea lass 2023 #homelealass homelealass com £ put the potholder in the water and leave it until the wool fibres have all been soaked in water check it regularly while it s soaking and don t leave it for longer than 30 minutes as we don t want the colours to run £ if the wool detergent requires rinsing do this £ take the potholder out of the water and lay it flat on a towel rolling it up to remove the excess water £ lay the potholder flat in a spot where it can dry without being disturbed and give it a jiggle / adjust the shape so that it s square you can check this by measuring the length of the edges £ don t press down on the potholder because we want the stitches to puff up and down £ leave the potholder the dry and then it s ready to be used congratulations congratulations on finishing the happy potholder it s been an absolute pleasure to help you and i hope you ve enjoyed it which homelea lass crochet kit will you make next with love lynda 17 happy potholder uk and us terminology v1 2 a homelea lass® crochet pattern ©homelea lass 2023 #homelealass homelealass com
